title: Bihar polls by Oct-end? EC holds all-party meet; suggestions on dates, phases
content: The Election Commission met political parties on Saturday. They discussed Bihar assembly polls. Parties urged polls after the Chhath festival. They also asked for fewer phases. Reforms like voter cap and Form 17C were welcomed. Janata Dal (United) sought a single-phase election. BJP asked agents to collect Form 17C. Election dates will be announced soon.

title: ‘Op Gaanjaney’: How ATS tracked ex-NSG commando in 200kg drug bust; kingpin had political ambitions
content: Rajasthan ATS apprehended former NSG commando Bajrang Singh, wanted in a 200kg ganja smuggling case. Singh, who served in the 26/11 Mumbai operation and retired in 2021, became a narcotics kingpin, leveraging local connections after failed political ambitions. He was tracked for two months using technical intelligence and informers, culminating in his arrest under 'Operation Gaanjaney'.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. Despite this, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue. The embassy's X account will only provide urgent safety and security updates during this period.

title: Monk robes to vegetarian food: What Delhi 'godman' wants in jail?
content: Self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyananda was remanded to 14 days judicial custody by a Delhi court over sexual harassment allegations at a management institute. Police added a charge for threatening a woman after the case was registered. His counsel sought preservation of evidence and specific provisions for his stay, on which the court sought police response.

title: Sean Combs case: Meet Arun Subramanian? Indian-origin judge who sentenced ‘Diddy’ to 4 yrs in jail
content: District Judge Arun Subramanian sentenced Sean “Diddy” Combs to 50 months in prison and a $500,000 fine for prostitution-related offenses, citing his history of violence. Subramanian, a 45-year-old Indian-origin judge appointed by President Biden, earned praise for his measured yet firm handling of the high-profile trial, maintaining decorum amidst intense public scrutiny.

title: Trump's Gaza plan: Israel prepares for '1st stage'; what is the 20-point proposal?
content: Hamas partially accepted President Trump's peace plan for Gaza, expressing readiness for immediate talks on hostage release and ending the conflict. Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu also prepared to implement the plan's first stage. The proposal outlines a deradicalized Gaza, technocratic governance, and a pathway to Palestinian self-determination, with Trump overseeing redevelopment efforts.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
content: The US Army's chief technology officer issued a memo labeling the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril, as "very high risk" due to fundamental security flaws. Concerns include uncontrolled data access, unmonitored user actions, and unverified software security, potentially allowing adversaries persistent access and misuse of classified information.

title: Maoists must surrender by March 2026, says Amit Shah in Chhattisgarh
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has set a firm March 2026 deadline for Maoists to surrender, stating talks will only be considered after they lay down arms. He warned of intensified operations if they fail to comply, emphasizing Bastar's desire for peace and development.

title: Cough syrup row: Tests confirm presence of poisonous chemical; MP bans sale of 'Coldrif'
content: Seven children in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district died from consuming Coldrif cough syrup, confirmed to contain the toxic industrial chemical diethylene glycol (DEG). Following Tamil Nadu lab test results, the Madhya Pradesh government banned Coldrif and all products by Sresan Pharmaceuticals, ordering immediate statewide seizure of stocks.

title: 'Roots infested with insects': PM slams Congress-RJD for Bihar's 'migration crisis'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticised previous RJD-Congress governments for Bihar's education system devastation and mass migration, crediting CM Nitish Kumar and the NDA for its revival. He highlighted 10 lakh new government jobs, a significantly increased education budget, and launched youth-oriented projects worth over ₹62,000 crore, including a new skill university and revamped student schemes.

title: ‘English did not rule India’: Elon Musk replies to viral post; sparks outrage
content: Elon Musk's 'thinking face' emoji reaction to a controversial X post, which argued that British rule in India wasn't colonization if Indians in England become English, sparked widespread outrage. Users heavily criticized Musk and the post's flawed logic, emphasizing the stark difference between legal immigration and violent colonial subjugation, and reminding him of historical atrocities.

title: Japan to get first woman PM: Sanae Takaichi elected LDP leader; known for hard-line China stance
content: Sanae Takaichi was elected leader of Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party. She is now the most likely candidate to become Japan's first female prime minister. Takaichi defeated Shinjiro Koizumi in a runoff vote. She replaces Shigeru Ishiba. Takaichi served under Shinzo Abe. She shares his nationalist views and seeks military modernisation.

title: US shutdown: Military families seek food aid as WH warns of wider impact
content: The US government shutdown continues for a third day. Military families face financial anxiety and seek food assistance. White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt highlights impacts on 1.3 million service members unpaid. WIC programs and air traffic controllers also face jeopardy. The shutdown could cost the US economy billions weekly. Lawmakers have not reached a resolution.

title: 'Demanding Rs 30k maintenance on Rs 12k salary': Man brutally beaten by in-laws
content: Kunal, who married against his in-laws' wishes, was brutally assaulted in Sonipat by his wife's father, uncle, and associates. His arms and legs were broken after he posted marriage photos online, which angered the family who had allegedly arranged her second marriage. Police registered an FIR, and Kunal is undergoing treatment.

title: Lakers vs Suns Preseason Game 1: Full injury report for October 3, 2025
content: Robert Griffin III and his family miraculously survived a terrifying car accident in Fort Worth, Texas, where their van spun and hit barriers, but everyone escaped uninjured. Griffin expressed immense relief and gratitude online following the incident. He is now preparing to commentate a Big 12 game in his home state, transitioning from a star player to a sports analyst.

title: Usman Nurmagomedov vs Paul Hughes 2: PFL Champions Series 3 results - highlights
content: The PFL Champions Series 3 in Dubai delivered an electric atmosphere, highlighted by Usman Nurmagomedov's successful lightweight title defense against Paul Hughes in their highly anticipated rematch. Nurmagomedov dominated with grappling and striking, securing a decision victory. The event also showcased other thrilling bouts across various weight divisions, establishing new contenders and champions.

title: NFL trade rumors: 49ers, Ravens eye Giants’ star Kayvon Thibodeaux
content: San Francisco 49ers seek a top pass rusher after Nick Bosa's injury. They show interest in New York Giants' defensive end Kayvon Thibodeaux. Giants are assessing their defensive line depth. They might consider trading Thibodeaux for draft picks or a player. This potential move could strengthen the 49ers' defense. The trade deadline approaches.

title: Hostage release but ... : Hamas agrees to Trump’s Gaza peace plan with conditions - What are they?
content: Hamas partially accepted Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan, agreeing to release all Israeli hostages if conditions are met. However, the group seeks further negotiations on crucial clauses concerning Gaza's future governance, Israeli withdrawal, and its own role. Trump urged Israel to halt bombing for hostage release, while warning of severe consequences if the deal ultimately fails.

title: 'Why would he visit at night?': Dalit man wanting to go to temple assaulted; FIR filed
content: A Dalit labourer was allegedly assaulted and threatened in Himatnagar after expressing a wish to visit a temple. Upon showing his Aadhaar card, an accused subjected him to casteist slurs and physical abuse, questioning his presence as a Dalit. He was later driven away and warned against returning, prompting an FIR under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

title: ‘Jabo de’: Bandmate recalls Zubeen Garg’s final moments; alleges he was frothing at mouth
content: Singer Zubeen Garg died under mysterious circumstances. His manager Siddharth Sharma faces arrest. Witnesses allege poisoning and criminal conspiracy. Sharma reportedly dismissed symptoms during Garg's final moments. He allegedly controlled the yacht and supplied liquor. Other statements corroborate Sharma's actions. Financial records and witness accounts establish culpability. Police now treat this as a premeditated murder.

title: 'Confiscate diplomatic passport': Nishikant hits out at Rahul over Colombia speech
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey demanded the confiscation of Rahul Gandhi's diplomatic passport and legal action, following Gandhi's criticism of the Indian government's "attack on Indian democracy" during a visit to Colombia. Dubey compared Gandhi's "baseless statements" to controversial figures, also slamming Congress for opposing climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's NSA arrest and recalling the party's historical actions during the Emergency.

title: U'khand: 22-yr-old merchant navy’s senior deck cadet goes missing at sea; search ops on
content: A 22-year-old senior deck cadet, Karandeep Singh Rana, went missing from a merchant navy vessel. The ship was traveling from Iraq to China via Sri Lanka and Singapore. His family last contacted him on September 20. The shipping company confirmed his disappearance overboard. A 96-hour search operation was conducted. The vessel is now heading to China for a full investigation.

title: US firm fires Indian staff in 4 minutes; offers 8 coping tips for layoffs
content: A US-based company recently laid off its Indian workforce in just four minutes during a virtual meeting, leaving employees shocked and unprepared. Beyond the financial impact, the emotional toll was severe. The focus is on the human side of sudden layoffs and eight practical coping strategies including financial planning, career rebuilding, and mental well-being to help professionals manage unexpected job loss.

title: Kidney transplant breakthrough: Scientists create universal donor kidney
content: Scientists converted a type A kidney into a type O universal donor kidney. Enzymes removed specific antigens from the organ. The converted kidney worked normally for two days in a brain-dead patient. Antigens then reappeared. This research shows a path to reduce kidney transplant waiting times. It could benefit many type O patients.

title: Karur Stampede: Stalin promises SOP; TN CM says it will serve as model for entire nation
content: Chief Minister MK Stalin addressed the Karur stampede, which killed 41 during actor Vijay's campaign, announcing a comprehensive SOP and a Special Investigation Team. He affirmed the state's commitment to accountability and preventing future tragedies, urging stakeholders to unite for a long-term solution.

title: ‘Starting to diversify’: Is India cutting back on Russian oil? What Trump aide said
content: US trade representative Jamieson Greer claimed India is diversifying from Russian oil, despite a 50% tariff imposed, half of which targets India's recent surge in Russian oil purchases. Conversely, Russian President Vladimir Putin asserted India will continue energy imports from Russia, suggesting increased Russian imports of Indian goods to balance trade.

title: Poll-bound Bihar in focus: PM unveils Rs 62,000cr youth-focused initiatives
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi unveiled youth-centric initiatives exceeding Rs 62,000 crore, significantly impacting poll-bound Bihar. Key launches include the Rs 60,000 crore PM-SETU scheme to modernize ITIs, new vocational labs, and enhanced financial aid for students. Modi also inaugurated a skill university and dedicated NIT Patna's Bihta campus, underscoring a commitment to youth empowerment and skill development.

title: Outrageous! Sahibzada Farhan unveils controversial AK-47 ‘gunmode’ sticker
content: Sahibzada Farhan unveiled a new "Gunmode" bat sticker, inspired by his controversial AK-47 celebration against India during the Asia Cup. Despite Pakistan's team collapse and loss, Farhan was felicitated for these theatrics. Critics argue such personal flair overshadows sportsmanship and true cricketing achievement, a trend reinforced by his new sticker.

title: Meerut: Cloth trader shot dead by friends; accused uploads video online
content: Meerut: A 25-year-old man was allegedly shot dead by his friends in a forested area, with the gruesome act recorded and circulated online. Police suspect Mohd Adil was lured and killed over suspicions of betraying rivals in a previous murder.

title: Rarest of rare: 'Foetus-in-foetus’ baby delivered at Karnataka hospital
content: Karnataka Medical College and Research Institute successfully delivered a baby with a rare "foetus-to-foetus" condition on September 23. An inner, undeveloped foetus, described as a parasitic twin with rudimentary spine and skull, was found within the newborn. Both mother and baby are stable. Doctors deem this a "rarest of the rare" case, planning further tests and documentation for medical journals.

title: '38-point charter': Pak govt reaches agreement with protestors on 25 points
content: Protests in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir concluded after an agreement. The Pakistan government and protestors signed a 25-point charter. This followed days of violence and unrest in the region. The deal includes compensation for victims and significant developmental measures. Key provisions cover education, health, and electricity improvements. Administrative reforms and infrastructure projects are also part of the agreement.

title: Cash & jewellery looted: 2 Indians arrested for robbing sex workers in Singapore hotel
content: Two Indian men, Arokkiyasami Daison and Rajendran Mayilarasan, were sentenced to five years and one month in prison with 12 strokes of the cane in Singapore. They pleaded guilty to assaulting and robbing two women in hotel rooms after being approached by a man offering sex workers. The men cited financial hardship as their motive for the crimes.

title: UPSC answer key: Will it be published before prelims results? What we know so fa
content: A circulating affidavit claims UPSC will release provisional answer keys for the Civil Services Prelims immediately after the exam, inviting candidate objections before finalisation. However, UPSC Chairman Dr Ajay Kumar clarified no such change is official yet. The matter is sub-judice before the Supreme Court, and candidates are advised to rely only on UPSC’s official notifications.

title: 'Relief must rise above politics': Priyanka hits out at Centre after Wayanad floods
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized the Centre for approving only ₹260 crore for Wayanad landslide relief, a fraction of Kerala's ₹2,221 crore request. She stressed that human suffering should not be politicized. Meanwhile, CM Pinarayi Vijayan stated the sanctioned funds haven't arrived, and Kerala's demands for national disaster status and loan waivers remain unaddressed.

title: Vijay Deverakonda & Rashmika Mandanna engaged; fans react
content: Bollywood stars Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna have officially confirmed their engagement, sending fans into a frenzy. Vijay's team verified the news on Saturday, leading to widespread celebration online. The couple, who reportedly began dating in 2018 after 'Geetha Govindam', had previously kept their relationship private. Fans are now showering the beloved pair with congratulations.

title: 'I love Mohammad' row: SP delegation stopped from visiting Bareilly
content: Uttar Pradesh opposition leader Mata Prasad Pandey was barred from visiting Bareilly by police, who cited potential disruption following recent "I Love Mohammad" protests. The administration had suspended internet services and arrested 81 individuals, including IMC leaders, after violent demonstrations. Pandey criticized the move, claiming authorities were hiding their shortcomings.

title: India's first underwater Brahmaputra tunnel likely to get Cabinet nod - top facts
content: Assam's ambitious ₹6,000 crore underwater tunnel project, India's first under a major river, cnnecting Numaligarh and Gohpur, awaits Union cabinet approval. Expected to take five years, it will facilitate both road and rail traffic, significantly boosting regional connectivity and defence capabilities.

title: Screening foreign students for 'American values': What it means for Indian aspirants
content: The Trump administration's new policy requires US universities to screen foreign students for support of American and Western values and check for hostility to the US or its allies. Indian students, a significant group in the US, face increased ideological scrutiny alongside visa challenges. This screening involves background checks and reporting to federal agencies, affecting admissions and campus diversity. The policy is part of wider educational reforms linking federal funding to ideological alignment, raising concerns about academic freedom and economic impact.

title: Nasa shuts down: Why the oldest space agency has stopped functioning
content: NASA scales back most operations due to a US government funding deadlock. This action impacts many ongoing projects. Essential tasks like monitoring astronauts on the ISS continue. However, research and mission planning face delays. Programmes like Artemis could see postponed timelines. Past shutdowns show similar disruptions. This situation affects global scientific collaboration.

title: Watch: Chicago official shoved and handcuffed by ICE at hospital
content: Chicago Alderperson Jessie Fuentes was shoved and handcuffed by federal immigration agents at a medical center while questioning their warrant. Mayor Brandon Johnson condemned ICE's "abusive tactics," asserting officials' right to document actions. This incident highlights increased, militarized immigration enforcement in Humboldt Park, drawing widespread condemnation from local leaders and organizations.

title: Bihar elections: CEC-led EC delegation arrives in Patna; reviews poll preparations
content: An ECI delegation, led by CEC Gyanesh Kumar, arrived in Patna to review preparations for the upcoming Bihar Assembly elections, holding an all-party meeting. This follows a briefing for Central Observers, whom Kumar called "beacons of democracy" for ensuring free and fair polls. Bihar's election dates are expected to be announced on October 6 or 7.

title: Accident or murder? Zubeen Garg’s bandmate levels big allegations; claims manager ‘poisoned’ singer
content: The investigation into singer Zubeen Garg's death intensified as bandmate Shekhar Jyoti Goswami alleged manager Siddharth Sharma and organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta poisoned him. Sharma, Mahanta, Goswami, and co-singer Amritprabha Mahanta were arrested, with murder charges now added. Zubeen's wife also questioned the circumstances surrounding his death in Singapore, as the SIT continues its sensitive probe.

title: Season’s first cyclone, ‘Shakhti’, forms over Arabian Sea; IMD warns of high sea activity
content: The season's first Arabian Sea cyclonic storm, 'Shakhti', intensified on Friday, currently positioned west-southwest of Dwarka. Expected to become a severe cyclonic storm, it is unlikely to significantly impact Indian landmass, though remnants may bring rain to Gujarat. Sea conditions will be very rough, prompting warnings for fishermen. Meanwhile, Maharashtra anticipates light to moderate rain due to another system.

title: FBI Chief Kash Patel Fires Trainee For Displaying Pride Flag At Workplace
content: FBI Director Kash Patel dismissed a bureau trainee on Wednesday, October 1, for previously displaying a Pride flag at his workstation, according to sources cited by CNN.

title: Explained: What Is Diethylene Glycol Found In 'Coldrif' Cough Syrup At Tamil Nadu Unit
content: Diethylene Glycol (DEG) and Ethylene Glycol (EG) are industrial solvents used in antifreeze, paints, brake fluids, and plastics.

title: Irregularities In Sabarimala Temple's Gold Plating Sparks Political Row
content: The controversy over alleged irregularities in the gold plating of the Sabarimala temple sanctum has snowballed into a political issue, as the Travancore Devaswom Board said there were no lapses, while the Pandalam Palace demanded an investigation.

title: "You Had Money, Power...": Indian-Origin Judge To 'Diddy' Before Sentencing
content: India-origin Judge Arun Subramanian delivered a stern message on accountability, justice and hope as he sentenced Sean “Diddy” Combs to over four years in prison.

title: 'Marital Quarrels Don't Amount To Suicide Abetment': Allahabad High Court Discharges Wife, In-Laws
content: The Allahabad High Court, in an order in an abetment to suicide case in Uttar Pradesh, has observed that marital discord and domestic disputes are quite common, and if a spouse commits suicide for this reason, it cannot be considered as abetment.

title: Cough Syrup Row: Madhya Pradesh Bans 'Coldrif' After NDTV Report
content: For nearly a week, the Madhya Pradesh government maintained that it was "awaiting reports" and that "no toxic elements had been found so far."

title: 'Why Stop Us If All Normal?' Samajwadi MP As UP Cops Block Bareilly Visit
content: Samajwadi Party MP Zia Ur Rehman Barq on Saturday questioned the Uttar Pradesh government's move to prevent a party delegation from visiting Bareilly amid the ongoing controversy surrounding the 'I Love Muhammad' slogan.

title: "No More Beards, Long Hair": Pete Hegseth's Military Grooming Rules Draw Criticism From Sikhs
content: US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth's recent remarks on military grooming standards have drawn sharp criticism from the Sikh Coalition, a leading advocacy group for Sikhs in the US military. The new grooming rule restricts beards and long hair.

title: BJP Warming Up To Vijay? TVK Gets Key Assurance Days After Stampede
content: The BJP has reached out to South superstar Vijay's party days after the Karur stampede, said sources, hinting that the saffron party is working to utilise the actor's massive fan base to improve its chances in the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections.

title: "Will Bring Out Full Truth": MK Stalin On Vijay's Karur Rally Stampede
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Saturday expressed deep anguish over the recent tragedy in Karur and assured that the state government is taking all measures to ensure accountability and prevent future disasters.

title: Family Cremates Another Man After Dead Bodies Mix Up At Delhi Hospital
content: The two bodies were mixed up, because of which, one of them was cremated by a family mistaking it for their relative's.

title: Manipur Police vs Ceasefire-Linked UKLF: A Tangle Over SoO Ground Rules
content: The Manipur Police's attempt to arrest a man whom they called a "suspected drug kingpin" has raised fundamental questions on law enforcement in the border state that is yet to fully recover from ethnic tension.

title: Arun Subramanian: Indian-Origin US Judge Who Jailed Sean 'Diddy' Combs For Over 4 Years
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs was sentenced to over four years in prison following convictions on prostitution-related charges. The sentence was delivered by an Indian-origin Judge Arun Subramanian.

title: Pakistan Approaches US To Construct Port On Arabian Sea: Report
content: Advisers to Pakistani army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir have approached US officials with an offer to build and run a port on the Arabian Sea, the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing a plan seen by the newspaper.

title: 'No Remorse, No Responsibility': Madras High Court Raps Vijay's Party After Stampede
content: The Madras High Court has come down heavily on South superstar Vijay's Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) party over last week's stampede in Karur.

title: Cough Syrup Row: Tamil Nadu Acts Within A Day, Madhya Pradesh Probe Drags On
content: While Tamil Nadu tested, confirmed, and banned the suspected batch within 24 hours, Madhya Pradesh is still "awaiting reports".

title: Sanae Takaichi, Once A Heavy Metal Drummer, Set To Be Japan's 1st Woman PM
content: Sanae Takaichi, the newly elected and staunchly conservative head of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, is expected to become Japan's first woman prime minister, but that doesn't mean she's a feminist choice, analysts say.

title: SBI To Release Dead Depositor's FD With Interest, Compensate Son In Kerala
content: The Ernakulam District Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission, here, has ordered the SBI to repay a dead depositor's Fixed Deposit (FD) maturity proceeds and pay compensation to his son, for failing to release the money citing missing records.

title: Pakistan Government, Protesters Sign Agreement To End Protests In PoK
content: Violence marred the peace of the region due to a strike, which began on September 29 when talks broke down between officials and leaders of the Jammu Kashmir Joint Awami Action Committee (JKJAAC), a representative body of protestors.

title: Hammon's words prescient as bench carries Aces
content: Dana Evans (21 points) led an Aces bench that outscored the Mercury's reserves 41-16 en route to an 89-86 win in Game 1 of the WNBA Finals on Friday night.

title: Engelbert vows to 'do better,' denies Clark remark
content: WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert said there were "inaccuracies" in some of the comments attributed to her by Napheesa Collier earlier this week, but acknowledged she has to "do better" in growing her relationship with players.

title: Boone fires back at Jays broadcaster: 'He's wrong'
content: The Yankees landed in Toronto with some bulletin board material ahead of the ALDS, courtesy of Blue Jays television color analyst and former major leaguer Buck Martinez.

title: Schlittler: Fan heckling of family 'crossed the line'
content: Yankees starter Cam Schlittler on Friday said Red Sox fans "crossed the line" by harassing family members, including his mother, on social media ahead of his Game 3 start in the AL Wild Card Series.

title: Schumaker to manage Rangers on 4-year deal
content: Skip Schumaker, the 2023 National League Manager of the Year with the Marlins, was hired as Rangers manager, agreeing Friday night on a four-year contract.

title: Bronny cold in debut, but Redick praises growth
content: Bronny James struggled through a 1-for-12 shooting performance in his preseason debut, but Lakers coach JJ Redick said he is "a totally different player than he was a year ago."

title: Tajh Ariza, ex-NBA veteran's son, picks Oregon
content: Top-25 recruit Tajh Ariza has committed to Oregon, he announced Friday, as the son of former NBA veteran Trevor Ariza chose the Ducks over USC.

title: Ex-Ravens, Syracuse DL Arthur Jones dies at 39
content: Arthur Jones, a defensive lineman who spent his first four NFL seasons in Baltimore and won a Super Bowl with the Ravens, has died. He was 39.

title: 🤞🏽 Can Purdue end Swift album drop 'curse'?
content: Purdue is 4-11 in its first game after a Taylor Swift album drops -- and 0-10 when that game falls within seven days of a release.

title: Critiques from former players and Dabo himself: Can Clemson change the narrative?
content: Frustrations are high at Clemson. Dabo Swinney and former players aren't shying away from the issues.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Marner in Vegas, Sullivan in New York and Crosby ... on the move? Guide to the NHL season
content: Miss anything the past few months? Miss everything? Get caught up here before opening night on Tuesday.

title: 13 more NFL Week 5 games, 13 matchup previews: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: Here's everything you need to know. Which teams will win, who are the X factors, and which storylines matter most?

title: How did the Browns decide on starting QB No. 41? Inside their 'intentional' methods
content: The quarterbacks room has been developed to give Dillon Gabriel (named Sunday's starter) and Shedeur Sanders space to grow.

title: Paolo Banchero, Trae Young: Breaking down 10 names that could define NBA season
content: ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks down players and personnel that will play major roles on the court and beyond.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 5: Jaxson Dart, Brenton Strange among top options
content: With many quality fantasy starters on byes this week, we have options at each position to fill in for you.

title: 📈 Ranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: A surprise No. 1
content: What have we learned about the signal-callers so far? Here's where Arch Manning, Beau Pribula and others stand.

title: 🩺 Tyreek Hill injury timeline, impact on Fins
content: What is the Dolphins WR's outlook for a dislocated knee, the on-field impact of his absence and his future in Miami.

title: 👊 MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: 🏆 Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: ⛳ Ryder envelope rule must change, Bradley says
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley said the Ryder Cup's longstanding envelope rule involving injured players should change, but European counterpart Luke Donald said it's there to protect players and should remain in place.

title: 🗣️ Players support Collier in ripping WNBA
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: 💰 Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: 🏈 Colts CB Howard abruptly retires
content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

title: Man United need to face reality: Amorim is not the club's biggest issue
content: Man United's decision-making is driven by the idea of where they think they ought to be, not where they are.

title: Man United draw vs. champions Chelsea signals power shift
content: Chelsea have dominated the WSL for six seasons, but Friday showed the Blues' grip on the league is weakening.

title: How The Rock transformed his body -- and mind -- into Mark Kerr
content: Becoming Mark Kerr, a 6-foot-3, 260-pound ex-MMA fighter, included a process unlike any other during Johnson's acting career.

title: Phillies' 9-9-9 Challenge box for 2025 postseason to feature 'fun size' hot dogs
content: The Phillies' Challenge box will offer "fun size" hot dogs and "petite" beers, as well as a built-in scoreboard for fans to track their progress.

title: Tottenham takeover: Top scenes from Vikings-Browns in London
content: The NFL went international in Week 5. Here's how Minnesota and Cleveland made the trip worth remembering in London.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs set to bid for Man Utd's Bruno in January
content: Saudi Pro League could come back in for Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Eric Karabell's 'Do not draft' list, including LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, Joel Embiid
content: Eric Karabell highlights the players to fade at their current average draft position in fantasy basketball drafts.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Fantasy hockey cheat sheet: The names you need to know when you draft your team
content: The fantasy hockey cheat sheet has everything you need to prepare for the draft on one printable PDF.

title: Give me a reason to draft this guy! Late-round picks
content: When you're in the late rounds of your draft, here are the players you should look at and the key reason why.

title: Russia hits Ukrainian passenger train; casualties feared
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: 'Made India bow': BJP guns for Sonia; says UPA govt was 'puppet in foreign hands'
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .

title: Seattle Mariners' crab helmet tops 2025 new ballpark grub
content: baseball teams are becoming more innovative and stepping up their food game in 2025 . the Seattle Mariners have a helmet full of crab claws for the postseason . they have an exclusive jaws milkshake and souvenir cup to celebrate the movie's 50th anniversary .

title: An all-time hater and a rivalry like no other: The Mannings vs. Florida
content: the longhorns have been a part of America's football consciousness for nearly 60 years . only one of the family's college football rivalries has included a spelling test, years of shade, and has spanned generations . the haters-in-chief, then as part of the redemptive end to the first college football run, was there .

title: Air Force's alternate uniforms inspired by F-16 headline top threads for Week 6
content: the threads will be worn for the first time Saturday as air force faces a fellow service academy . the uniforms' connection with the F-16 is extensive, with tributes to the fighter jet everywhere from the helmet to the pants . details on the jersey include two patches for the player's name .

title: 'He fought too many times': How the loss to Ankalaev forced Pereira to change
content: former middleweight and then-light heavyweight champion Alex Pereira complained about how he felt ahead of his title defense . pereira surrendered the light heavyweight championship to Magomed Ankalaev by unanimous decision in an eff . he is now one of the world's most dominant champions of all time .

title: Rollins creates more animosity with Cody, Orton
content: seth Rollins continues to question himself and be fueled by his desire for revenge and validation . the vision def. cody Rhodes and Randy Orton defeated Rhodes . a stomp on Orton was an interesting end because it adds another layer of animosity .

title: Why Alabama could move ahead early against Vandy
content: all odds by ESPN BET No. 16 Vanderbilt Commodores at no. 10 Alabama Crimson Tide at 3:30 p.m. ET, ABC Line: Alabama -10.5, 3-1 . a 5-0 win over alabama puts the team ahead of the playoffs . it's the kind of matchup that makes you pause before firing a bet .

title: Why Tommy Castellanos sets up FSU for success vs. Miami
content: a storm brewing in Tallahassee, and it's more than just the weather forecast . one team thrives on pressure, while the other thrives in it . what happens Saturday could reshape the entire ACC title race .

title: Haaland on pace to surpass Messi and Ronaldo's best seasons. Is that good for City?
content: pep Guardiola was trying to verbalize what made his team so different from their competitors . his wingers defended like defensive midfielders, his attacking midfielders facilitated the central runs of his wales . he said: "we play leftist football"

title: NDRF grants not being utilised for guarantee schemes: Karnataka CM
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said the success of the guarantee schemes had rattled BJP leaders, and such statements were born out of a fear of losing out

title: Muslim Students Federation, SFI protest after teachers halt pro-Palestine mime show in Kerala school
content: Police say mime show was stopped during arts festival at a school in Kumbala, Kasaragod. Two teachers intervened and asked students to stop the performance before pulling down the stage curtains

title: Five booked in fake selection list scam linked to National Health Mission in Kashmir
content: They fraudulently approached volunteers, obtained their documents on the pretext of securing permanent engagement under NHM, and also collected money from them, said the spokesperson

title: Union Minister praises Naidu’s vision, launches auto drivers’ welfare scheme in Guntur
content: The Minister, clad in a khaki shirt, joined a massive rally of over 200 autos from TB Bungalow to the Revenue Kalyana Mandapam before inaugurating the scheme alongside local MLA Galla Madhavi

title: Karur stampede | Justice and truth will come out, says Aadhav Arjuna
content: At the Dehradun airport, responding to queries from news agency ANI on the Madras High Court’s direction for an SIT probe, he said the party was working toward bringing justice in this matter

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Navi Mumbai International Airport on October 8
content: The Prime Minister will inaugurate the airport at 2.40 p.m. on October 8, and it will be operational from December

title: Minister Jagdish Vishwakarma named new Gujarat BJP chief
content: Jagdish Vishwakarma is currently serving as the Minister of State for co-operation, salt industries, MSME, cottage, khadi and rural industries.

title: Two drown in separate incidents in NTR, Krishna districts
content: A 10-year-old girl visiting her relatives slipped into Munneru stream while washing clothes and drowned, say the villagers

title: PM Modi should announce relief for flood-hit farmers during Mumbai visit: Sanjay Raut
content: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, during his Mumbai visit, called for PM Modi to announce flood relief for Maharashtra farmers

title: Five more roads in Kerala to be upgraded to national highway status
content: In a communication to the State, NHAI has informed that procedures for preparing project document to develop five more new national highways have been initiated, says Public Works Minister Mohamed Riyas

title: TDB president P.S. Prasanth sees ‘error’ in entrusting Sabarimala artefacts to private person for repair in 2019
content: Prasanth says TDB will transfer the warranty from Unnikrishnan Potty to the board’s name, with High Court’s permission

title: Coffee Board opens special kiosk in Bengaluru to train women in coffee business
content: The kiosk is aimed at offering training and promoting entrepreneurship among women in various activities related to coffee growing, coffee processing and coffee retailing

title: Kerala’s Thiruvonam bumper lottery results announced, ticket number TH 577825 wins ₹25-crore jackpot
content: Thiruvonam Bumper saw record sales this year. Kerala State Lotteries department had printed 75 lakh tickets, of which all but one, which was defective, were sold

title: Ten militants arrested from three districts of Manipur
content: The successful operation has dealt a crippling setback to UKNA’s networks in Churachandpur and Jiribam, reaffirming Assam Rifles’ relentless commitment to peace and security in the region, the paramilitary force said

title: Karur stampede | T.N. government will bring out truth through SIT probe, says CM Stalin
content: “We will hold discussions with domain experts, representatives of political parties, activists, and the public across the State to formulate a comprehensive Standard Operating Procedure (SOP),” he said in a post on X

title: Rhea Chakraborty gets her passport back after five years in Sushant Singh Rajput case
content: The 33-year-old actor  regains passport after legal battles. She expressed that “patience was my only passport for the past 5 years” in an Instagram post

title: Palakkad hospital under fire over alleged negligence as mishandling of girl’s hand fracture leads to amputation
content: Preliminary probe by two-member medical team finds drawbacks in treatment of hand fracture, suggesting that lapses in care contributed to the amputation

title: Pakistan Government, protesters sign agreement to end violent protests in PoK
content: Violence marred the peace of the region owing to a strike, when talks broke down between officials and leaders of the JKJAAC, a representative body of protestors

title: PM Modi unveils initiatives worth over ₹62,000 crore for youth; Bihar in focus
content: The Prime Minister launched PM-SETU (Pradhan Mantri Skilling and Employability Transformation through Upgraded ITIs), a centrally sponsored scheme with an investment of ₹60,000 crore

title: Postal services resume in Manipur's Churachandpur after more than 2 years
content: The vehicle reached the district headquarters at 11.30 a.m. on Friday, unloaded letters, parcels and other consignments, and returned to Imphal around 12.40 p.m.

title: Actor Ravi Mohan’s Bro Code faces legal trouble from alcoholic beverages company
content: Justice V. Lakshminarayanan of Madras High Court grants an interim injunction in favour of the production house

title: 6.5 crore women screened under ‘Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar’ health campaign: J.P. Nadda
content: The Union Health Minister called for continuing the momentum by encouraging every woman to prioritise her well-being, adopt regular health check-ups, and lead the way towards a healthier, empowered future

title: Allahabad High Court grants bail to man accused of sharing 'Pakistan Zindabad' post
content: Sajid Chaudhary, a resident of Meerut, was booked under Section 152 (endangering India's sovereignty) of the  Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) and had been in jail since May 13, 2025

title: The road bears witness, as institutions crumble
content: As Geetha Cafe — a corner hotel near the bustling Ritchie Street — moves into the realm of the past, it is also time to look back a touch wistfully at those various outposts that once lit up Mount Road and added value to the eternal high street of Madras

title: Any GST registration fraud probe shouldn’t be limited to Kerala govt, says former Finance Minister Thomas Isaac
content: In response to V.D. Satheesan’s charges, Thomas Isaac in a FB post says probe must extend to Central GST department as well

title: HYDRAA takes up demolition in Hyderabad’s Kondapur
content: A statement from HYDRAA said 36-acre government land was squatted on by unauthorised persons who built sheds from where they ran various commercial ventures

title: Cough syrup row: Rajasthan government suspends drug controller, halts distribution of Kaysons Pharma drugs
content: Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma has ordered a detailed probe into the matter along with effective action

title: Will release provisional answer keys after civil services prelims: UPSC tells Supreme Court
content: The decision, conveyed to the apex court in an affidavit, signalled a move away from the earlier practice of publishing keys only after the year-long recruitment cycle

title: NIA charges key accused in BKI-linked Chandigarh grenade attack case
content: The conspiracy was orchestrated by Pakistan-based BKI terrorist Harwinder Singh alias Rinda, in collusion with U.S.-based gangster Happy Passia, said an official statement

title: Meghalaya encourages filmmakers with incentives worth ₹1.50 crore
content: Under the policy, which is open to films in all languages, financial assistance of ₹1 crore will be extended to productions that shoot 75% of their content in Meghalaya

title: Chellanam in Kerala on edge again over delay in second-phase tetrapod seawall construction
content: Chellanam-Kochi Janakeeya Vedhi decides to mark its protest entering the seventh year by holding a day-long dharna at Thoppumpady on October 28. Plans for further protests are also under way

title: Rape-murder accused on the run kills 7-year-old girl in Maharashtra’s Thane district
content: A 33-year-old man allegedly raped and strangled his seven-year-old neighbour and stuffed her body in a gunny sack before fleeing the scene

title: Situation returns to normalcy in Belagavi after stone pelting
content: Belagavi city which had become tense after a stone pelting incident during a procession as part of Urs, has returned to normalcy with quick intervention of the Police

title: Vamsadhara, Nagavali, other rivers receive moderate inflows in Andhra’s Vizianagaram, Srikakulam districts
content: The life of the people living in Vangara, Santhakaviti, Regidi Amadalavalasa, Gajapathinagaram and other places of Vizianagaram district turned miserable under the impact of floods

title: GBA chief directs officials to complete Geddalahalli railway vent work in Bengaluru by December
content: The Commissioner directed that once the casting is complete, box pushing work must be expedited to meet the December deadline

title: IMD issues cyclone ‘Shakti’ warning for Maharashtra; heavy rains expected until October 7
content: Maharashtra Government has issued instructions for preparation in response to the cyclone ‘Shakti’ warning

title: Actor Vasishta Simha is brand ambassador for water conservation in Karnataka
content: The Minister informed that Vasishta Simha has agreed to serve as the ambassador without any remuneration

title: Two sisters killed as container truck hits scooter in Bengaluru
content: According to the police, the primary cause of the collision was reckless driving by the container truck driver

title: Pakistani drone sighted along International Border in J&K’s Samba; security forces launch search
content: The search operation was underway when last reports were received, officials said, adding that security has been heightened in adjoining villages as a precautionary measure

title: Gaza peace plan: PM Modi welcomes President Trump’s leadership amid ‘decisive’ progress in Gaza
content: The Prime Minister referred to the indications of the release of Israeli hostages by Hamas and said it marks a significant step forward in efforts to restore peace in the region

title: TMC, BJP step up political activities after Durga Puja in West Bengal
content: While the BJP leadership was huddled in a meeting with newly appointed election observers in Kolkata, the Trinamool Congress has announced an outreach of Vijaya Sammilani in all blocks across the State.

title: Two Indian tourists sentenced to jail for robbing, assaulting sex workers in Singapore hotels
content: The actions of Arokkiyasami Daison and Rajendran Mayilarasan came to light when a victim confided in another man about assaulting sex workers the following day, prompting the police to be called

title: Assam to set up judicial commission to probe Zubeen Garg's death; ED, I-T likely to join inquiry
content: Chief Minister Sarma said the commission will be headed by Justice Soumitra Saikia of the Gauhati High Court

title: In Karur, where there was no way out
content: On September 27, thousands of people gathered in Karur, Tamil Nadu, to attend a rally by actor-turned-politician Vijay. As the chief of the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam party arrived hours late, the crowd swelled and surged towards his vehicle, triggering a stampede that killed 41 people and injured over 100. C. Jaisankar and Nacchinarkkiniyan M. report on the tragedy, caused by many factors, including poor planning and alleged security lapses

title: CM to inaugurate Katpadi’s first government hospital
content: The hospital will boast separate sections for cardiology, neurology, paediatrics, nephrology, obstetrics, and gynaecology. It will also have separate wards for emergency and accident cases

title: Durga Puja is over, but Bengal colleges yet to complete undergraduate admissions
content: The State Government will be finally closing the centralised admission portal on October 10, and it has asked colleges to individually fill up vacant seats after that date and complete the whole process by November 7.

title: Vijayawada Utsav a cover for TDP’s loot, alleges  YSRCP leader
content: TDP leaders had collected somewhere between ₹70 crore and ₹100 crore from businesses, hotels, hospitals, and real estate firms in the name of Vijayawada Utsav, alleges Devineni Avinash

title: Water Metro to commence services to Mattancherry from mid-October
content: ‘Up to three ferries can berth at the floating pontoons at Mattancherry at a time, with one allowed to remain overnight, making it one of the biggest terminals’; ferries to run every 20 to 30 minutes

title: BIE releases tentative timetable for Intermediate Public Exams- 2026
content: Intermediate first-year students will write their exams from February 23 to March 24, while the final-year students will write their papers from February 24 to March 23

title: APSCHE launches portal to build link between colleges, industries
content: Operating guidelines for the admission process of CETs- 2025, in compliance with the orders of the A.P. High Court, have also been released

title: BJD accuses BJP government of complicity in recruitment scam in Odisha
content: The regional party demanded a CBI inquiry into the job scam which it alleged was murkier than Vyapam scam of Madhya Pradesh

title: Andhra Pradesh Energy Minister seeks French investments, highlights growth opportunities
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar pitches the State as an ideal destination for foreign investment in agriculture, electronics, green energy, and pharmaceuticals during a roadshow in Paris

title: Karur stampede: Court dismisses anticipatory bail pleas of TVK leaders ‘Bussy’ Anand, Nirmal Kumar
content: Justice M. Jothiraman dismissed the pleas, taking into consideration the gravity of the incident, and that the probe was at a preliminary stage, and the injured were still in hospital.

title: Mixed response to officials handling the media briefing on the Karur stampede
content: Opinion is divided among former civil servants and commentators. Some feel that the officials should not be involved in political matters and the political executive should be accountable for the whole episode. But some others see nothing wrong in what the officials have done

title: Lack of footpaths, increasing black spots behind rising pedestrian deaths in Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru ranked first in pedestrian fatalities, followed by Ahmedabad (236) and Jaipur (201), according to the NCRB data

title: Karnataka sees sharp rise in road accidents; Bengaluru among top five cities
content: Among 53 cities across India, Bengaluru ranked in the top five with a 30.3% increase in accidents; it was preceded by Ranchi (50.3%), Varanasi (46.3%), and Pune (35%)

title: Thirumavalavan’s call for action against Vijay ends speculation on a likely alliance with TVK
content: VCK general secretary D. Ravikumar says that Thirumavalavan   tried to be soft on the account of Mr. Vijay’s inexperience in politics, but changed his mind after listening to his video statement, in which he alluded to a conspiracy behind the death of 41 persons in the stampede at Karur

title: Mamata Banerjee attacks Centre-run Damodar Valley Corporation for water release from dams during heavy rain alert
content: Districts like Purba Bardhaman, Hooghly, Howrah, Murshidabad, and parts of Paschim Midnapore especially vulnerable to flooding, district and police officials on high alert, says Waterways and Irrigation Minister

title: Former Rajasthan Assembly Speaker Girraj Prasad Tiwari passes away at 105
content: Former CM Ashok Gehlot said Mr. Tiwari, who lived a splendid life up to the age of 105, was an example of discipline and vivacity

title: Pilots welfare group meets government agency probing AI 171 crash
content: Airline Pilots’ Association (ALPA)-India demands observer status in the probe to ensure accountability and transparency. After meeting AAIB and DGCA chiefs, its president, Captain Sam Thomas, says the association has been assured of quarterly meetings.

title: Cough syrups not contaminated, says Centre; T.N. test detects adulteration
content: Union Health Ministry says none of the cough syrup samples contained diethylene glycol or ethylene glycol that are known to cause serious kidney injury; Tamil Nadu says tests showed Coldrif batch had diethylene glycol, orders production halt

title: Mirwaiz allowed to visit Jama Masjid after 3 weeks, condemns coercive measures
content: Restrictions serve no purpose except to highlight the arbitrariness and high handedness of those wanting to rule by force rather than in the spirit of democracy, the Mirwaiz said

title: Centre fines ‘Drishti IAS’ for misleading advertisements
content: This is the second penalty imposed on Drishti IAS for similar conduct after the Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) had fined the institute ₹3 lakh in September 2024

title: Book listing ‘set of 21 copper plate inscriptions’ to be brought out soon
content: To be released by the Prime Minister on October 16; Archaeological Survey of India says it will contain inscriptions belonging to Vijayanagara, Reddi, Gajapati, Recharla Chiefs, Reddis of Rajamahendravarma, and Chamgalva dynasties and Nawabs of Kurnool

title: Srisailam temple restoration works sticking to original architectural style
content: The works are likely to be completed in the next six months and will ensure that the temple structure remains strong for the next 200 years without any further repairs, says K. Munirathnam Reddy, Director (Epigraphy), ASI Mysuru

title: Schools reopen up to Class 8 in Leh; L-G reviews security
content: Schools reopened a day after 26 local people, arrested for participating in the protests, were released from the Leh jail

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu expresses displeasure over conduct of some MLAs in Assembly
content: In-charge Ministers should take total responsibility for maintaining discipline among the MLAs and preventing repeated lapses, he says

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: the new york Knicks and Philadelphia 76ers are in Abu Dhabi for a preseason doubleheader beginning Thursday . the trip marks the fourth year of the NBA's games in the united arab Emirates . they were greeted with singing from locals and a quick drink .

title: What history tells us about five early-season trends
content: "Get Up" will discuss whether the Cowboys can still reach the playoffs with the "worst defense in football" it's typical to hear a lot about the pace of certain stats . but most of the time when you see "on pace for" stats, you have no idea which teams and players were on pace for similar things in the past .

title: Latest Madden ratings: Puka Nacua rises, Lamar Jackson falls
content: this week saw big gains for the new England Patriots across the board . 10 players getting ratings boosts and just two dropping a point or two . the Baltimore Ravens are in the opposite position, with 10 of their players dropping in points .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cook leads RBs in season scoring, Daniels is top-five QB
content: field Yates has Deebo Samuel as a top-20 fantasy wide receiver in week 5 against the Chargers . all mentions of fantasy points are for PPR formats, unless otherwise noted . RB James Cook rushed for 16 touchdowns last season, but seven running backs scored more .

title: Top regression candidates for 2025-26: Geekie, Scheifele, more
content: last season, there were plenty of opportunities for regression, given what occurred during the 2023-24 season . candidates for regression include those most likely to see a 10+% drop in production, whether it's goals or points, based on their situations .

title: Bills' 'Cold Front' Rivalry uniforms, Bucs and Seahawks' throwbacks top Week 5 threads
content: the Buffalo Bills will rock their all-white "Cold Front" threads against the new England Patriots on "Sunday Night Football" there's a chrome, iridescent charging buffalo on the sleeves and a buffalo as a helmet decal .

title: MLB playoff mega-preview: World Series odds, likely MVPs and more
content: the 2025 MLB playoffs are rolling along with all four game 1s starting Saturday . the playoffs will begin on saturday . all four teams will face each other in a series rematch . a team temperature is based on Bill James' formula for determining how "hot" or "cold" they are .

title: Way-too-early 2026 top-50 rankings
content: DH/SP Shohei Ohtani and New York Yankees OF Aaron Judge pick the first drafts in 2026 fantasy baseball drafts . he's averaging 54.5 home runs, 39.5 stolen bases and 140 runs over his two Dodgers seasons . Judge has missed only 14 games over the london 2012 season .

title: What -- if anything -- makes the Dodgers different than every defending MLB champ of the past 25 years?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers are 15 games above .500 in the national league division series . a sense of uneasiness lingered in a meeting with manager Dave Roberts . "he was talking to us about the importance of what was in front of us," says infielder .

title: How the Aces defeated the Mercury
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 89-86 in game 1 of the 2025 WNBA Finals on friday . Dana Evans scored 21 points off the bench, matching the game high of four-time MVP A'ja Wilson and Mercury star Kahleah Copper . jewell Loyd also added 18 points, making them the first pair of teammates with at least 15 points as reserves in a Finals game since 2019 .

title: Bama's shot at revenge, high stakes in the ACC and the 29 biggest games of Week 6
content: it feels like we know less about the college football landscape now than we did a month ago . it's into this murky world that we wade for Week 6 . last week boasted serious headliners that clarified the Big Ten's hierarchy .
